issue.title: [CF 1327] Show dot strength icon not working
issue.body:
Hi,

i would like to report a problem with the dot strenght tracking. I want to use an icon where i track the strength of my dots when they are below a certain value, but it seems that tmw cant track the current dotvalue. It should be working like: when my dot e.g. rake is e.g. <=30.000dmg show the icon (this should also include if the dot isnt up,because not being up would mean a value of 0.,right?)

I am using this icon with TMW version 8.2.0:

^1^T^SBuffOrDebuff^SHARMFUL ^SUnit^Starget ^SOnlyMine^B ^SType^Sbuff ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SDEBUFFTOOLTIP ^SChecked^B ^SOperator^S< ^SUnit^Starget ^SLevel^N30000 ^SName^SRake ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SShowTTText^B ^SName^SRake ^SEnabled^B ^SStates^T ^N1^T ^t^N2^T ^SAlpha^N1 ^t^N3^T ^t^N4^T ^t^t^t^N82008^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

I was also testing: Debuff - Aura Variable and Debuff - Tooltip Number #1 - #3. Debuff - Tooltip Number #2 isnt working at all while with the other conditions it seems only to track the "Opacity& Color" config in the main icon menu and ignoring the condition option.


> Posted by CurseForge user Mindfork | Imported from CurseForge issue #1327 | Raw

comments.body:
If you'd bothered to read the tooltip for the Aura Variable condition and/or icon setting, you would know that this setting is only as good as the data that Blizzard provides, and that it can certainly be wrong or useless.

As for the other part of what you said, I really don't know what that means.

Quote:

Debuff - Tooltip Number #2 isnt working at all while with the other conditions it seems only to track the "Opacity& Color" config in the main icon menu and ignoring the condition option.

Debuff - Tooltip Number #2 works just fine. In your case, it is going to be comparing against the number 3, since that's always the second number in Rake's tooltip. Tooltip Number #1 is the one that you want here, and it works great. When the condition fails, the Failed Conditions opacity level is used on the icon. I have no idea what "ignoring the condition option" means.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
